titleStmt.title: Walters Ms. W.591, Book on logic
Nikāt muta`allaqah bi-sharḥ al-Maṭāli` wa-ḥawāshih al-sharīfah
نكات متعلقة بشرح المطالع وحواشيه الشريفة

author.name: Muḥammad ibn Pīr Aḥmad al-shahīr bi-Ibn Arghūn al-Shīrāzī
محمد بن بير احمد الشهير بابن ارغون الشيرازي
Ibn Arghūn al-Shīrāzī
No information about this author is known.

respStmt.name: Muḥammad ibn Pīr Aḥmad al-shahīr bi-Ibn Arghūn al-Shīrāzī
محمد بن بير احمد الشهير بابن ارغون الشيرازي
Ibn Arghūn al-Shīrāzī

availability.p: Licensed for use under Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported Access Rights, http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/3.0/legalcode. It is requested that copies of any published articles based on the information in this data set be sent to the curator of manuscripts, The Walters Art Museum, 600 North Charles Street, Baltimore MD 21201.

notesStmt.note: The present work is a supergloss on the gloss (ḥāshiyah) by al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī (d. 816 AH / 1413 CE) on the Lawāmiʿ al-asrār by Qutb al-Dīn al-Taḥtānī al-Rāzī (d. 766 AH / 1364 CE), being in turn a commentary on a book of logic entitled Maṭāliʿ al-anwār by Sirāj al-Dīn Maḥmūd al-Urmawī (d. 682 AH / 1283 CE). Written for the library of the Ottoman Sultan Selim I, it was completed in Bursa in 918 AH / 1512 CE, the year of that ruler's accession to the throne. The text, which opens with an illuminated headpiece (fol. 1b), is written in naskh script mostly in black ink with certain words, such as qawluhu and aqūlu, in red. It is possible that the scribe is also the author of this work. The brown goatskin binding with central lobed oval and pendants with arabesque designs is contemporary with the manuscript.

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Arabic. The secondary language of this manuscript is Turkish, Ottoman (1500-1928).

msItem.title: Nikāt muta`allaqah bi-sharḥ al-Maṭāli` wa-ḥawāshih al-sharīfah
نكات متعلقة بشرح المطالع وحواشيه الشريفة
msItem.incipit: الحمد لله الذى اطلع شموس المطالب الكمالية من مطالع الانظار...
msItem.note: Clean copy; no marginal corrections or glosses

colophon.note: tamma wa-al-ḥamd li-Llāh awwalan wa--<ā>khiran wa-al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām ʿalá rasūlih Muḥammad /1/ wa-ālih wa-ṣaḥbih bāṭinan wa-ẓāhiran ʿalá anāmil afqar khalq Allāh wa-aḥwajihim /2/ Muḥammad ibn Pīr Aḥmad al-shahīr bi-Arghūn al-Shīrāzī ʿafá Allāh ʿanhumā fī <ā>akhir Shaʿbān /3/ li-sanat thamān ʿashar wa-tisʿimi<ʾ>ah al-hijrīyah bi-baldat [sic] /4/ al-ṭayyibah al-Būrsah ḥafiẓahā Allāh /5/ ʿan al-<ā>fāt /6/ tamma /7/
Gives the name of the scribe, date, and place of copying

supportDesc.foliation: Fols. 80-83 blank; main text ends on fol. 79a

p.catchwords: On versos, written obliquely outside the frame close to the page edge

layoutDesc.layout: Framing lines in gold and black

handDesc.handNote: Main text written in small naskh script mostly in black ink; certain words, such as qawluhu and aqūlu written in red or with extended horizontal strokes overlined in red; doxologicial formula (basmalah) inscribed in the headpiece on fol. 1b in white tawqī`script; part of the dedication on fol. 2a in gold riqāʿ script

decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated headpiece inscribed with the doxological formula (basmalah) in tawqī script (fol. 1b); part of the dedication in gold riqāʿ script (fol. 2a); framing lines in gold and black

decoNote.title: Binding
decoNote.note: Binding
This brown goatskin binding with large lobed oval and pendants and gold decorative frames is contemporary with the manuscript, which is dated to 918 AH / 1512 CE.

decoNote.title: Page with former ownership notations and seals
decoNote.note: Ownership notations; seals
This is the first page of the manuscript, inscribed with various ownership statements, seals of previous owners, and a bequest (waqf) entry.

decoNote.title: Illuminated incipit page with headpiece
decoNote.note: Nikat muta`allaqah bi-sharh al-Matali` wa-hawashih al-sharifah
Incipit; headpiece
This incipit page has an illuminated headpiece with the doxological formula (basmalah) in the cartouche in white tawqī` script on a gold ground.

decoNote.title: Text page with dedication to the Ottoman Sultan Selim I
decoNote.note: Nikat muta`allaqah bi-sharh al-Matali` wa-hawashih al-sharifah
Text page
The line written in gold riqāʿ script on this page refers the Ottoman Sultan Selim I, to whom this work is dedicated. The bequest (waqf) seal of Bashīr Aghā, dated 1130 AH / 1717 CE, is at the left.

decoNote.title: Text page with seal
decoNote.note: Nikat muta`allaqah bi-sharh al-Matali` wa-hawashih al-sharifah
Text page; seal
This text page has the bequest (waqf) seal of Bashīr Aghā, dated 1130 AH / 1717 CE, at the left.

decoNote.title: Explicit page with colophon
decoNote.note: Nikat muta`allaqah bi-sharh al-Matali` wa-hawashih al-sharifah
Explicit; colophon
The final page of this manuscript ends with the colophon written within a triangular form.

decoNote.title: Notes in Ottoman Turkish and Arabic
decoNote.note: Scribal notations
This page has inscribed notes in Ottoman Turkish and Arabic, the first one signed by Muḥammad Bahā’ī.

decoNote.title: Page with autograph entry
decoNote.note: Autograph entry
This page has a question-and-answer in Ottoman Turkish regarding pious requests, most probably by the jurist Abū al-Suʿūd Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-ʿImādī (d. 982 AH / 1574 CE).

note.p: For the jurist Abū al-Suʿūd Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-ʿImādī (d. 982 AH / 1574 CE), see GAL 2:579; S2:651, as noted in the bibliography.

binding.p: Brown goatskin (with flap); central lobed oval and pendants with arabesque designs on a gold ground and decorative frames; doublures of red leather with small central design and gold frame

history.provenance: [Ex libris] Bashīr Aghā Dār al-Saʿādah, dated 1158 AH / 1745 CE [plus his seal] (fol. 1a, middle of the page); same seal also on fols. 32b and 78a

[Bequest entry (in Turkish nastaʿlīq script)] On behalf of Bashīr Aghā, in the hand of Muḥammad Amīn, inspector of awqāf [with his seal and the shelfmark 419, as well as the bequest (waqf) seal of al-Ḥājj Bashīr Aghā Dār al-Saʿādah, dated 1130 AH / 1717 CE] (fol.1a); same seal also present on fols. 2a, 35a, 52a, and 77b; shelf mark 419 also inscribed on the tail edge
history.acquisition: Walters Art Museum, 1931, by Henry Walters bequest

listBibl.head: Relevant Works
listBibl.bibl: For the main text and various commentaries and glosses see Brockelmann, Carl. Geschichte der arabischen Litteratur (New York; Köln: E.J. Brill, 1996), 1:614; S1: 848.
